nodes.bodyText: I think this is a bogus from IDEA. We are building with -Werror -Xlint:all so if those do not report anything, then I'd not bother with it.
it just blocks the compilation in that environment. Overriding the options for each branch I work on is tedious.

Can you please be more specific what fails?
If I add any line which causes warning such as ArrayList<String> aa = new ArrayList(Arrays.asList("a"));, then the compilation fails so -Werror -Xlint:all seem to work ok.
I've tried compiling with JDK8 and JDK15 and there seems to be no difference.
https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/api/java/lang/SuppressWarnings.html says that it should be used for compiler warnings.
If the compiler is not producing any warnings, then how come IDEA fails?
Also, I think the warning is legitimate - Bytes is a raw type after all.

Also, I think the warning is legitimate - Bytes is a raw type after all.

What I'm concerned about is why javac is not reporting anything.

If I checkout master at efa341d and compile the project (Ctrl+F9) in IDEA Ultimate 2020.2, it results in the error:

The IDE is setup to use /usr/lib/jvm/default-java/bin/java which is currently:
$ /usr/lib/jvm/default-java/bin/java -version
openjdk version "11.0.7" 2020-04-14
OpenJDK Runtime Environment (build 11.0.7+10-post-Ubuntu-2ubuntu219.10)
OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM (build 11.0.7+10-post-Ubuntu-2ubuntu219.10, mixed mode, sharing)
Checking the 'Java compiler' settings it has these options for the 'suggester' module where this code resides:
If you run export JAVA_HOME=/usr/lib/jvm/default-java/ && ./mvnw clean compile, then it works fine?
And yes, I don't see this in the builds done via Maven.

Checking the output in the 'Build Output' tab it indeed uses Java 11.0.7:
Executing pre-compile tasks...
Loading Ant Configuration...
Running Ant Tasks...
Running 'before' tasks
Checking sources
Copying resources... [suggester]
Copying resources... [plugins]
Copying resources... [opengrok-web]
Copying resources... [opengrok]
Parsing java... [suggester]
java: Errors occurred while compiling module 'suggester'
Checking dependencies... [suggester]
Dependency analysis found 0 affected files
javac 11.0.7 was used to compile java sources
Finished, saving caches...
Module "opengrok-dist" was fully rebuilt due to project configuration/dependencies changes
Compilation failed: errors: 1; warnings: 1
Executing post-compile tasks...
Loading Ant Configuration...
Running Ant Tasks...
Synchronizing output directories...
06.10.20 16:16 - Build completed with 1 error and 1 warning in 2 s 616 ms
Hmm, this is weird. I'd say that this is IDEA bug. IMHO it should not report warnings not found by the compiler.
Well, it is strange. I wonder how IDEA runs javac. Bug or not, it hampers my work :-)

Changed the log4j configuration of IDEA per https://intellij-support.jetbrains.com/hc/en-us/articles/207241085-Locating-IDE-log-files and here's relevant excerpt from the build.log file:
2020-10-06 16:49:17,295 [   1829]  DEBUG - s.incremental.java.JavaBuilder - Compiling chunk [suggester] with options: "-g -deprecation -Xlint:all -Werror -Xlint:-auxiliaryclass -Xlint:-fallthrough -encoding UTF-
8 --release 8 -s /home/vkotal/opengrok-git-vladak/suggester/target/generated-sources/annotations", mode=in-process

eader.java at (49:26)
